newsitem.title: SPAIN: RALLYING-MAKINEN EXTENDS CHAMPIONSHIP LEAD WITH CATALUNYA WIN.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING-MAKINEN EXTENDS CHAMPIONSHIP LEAD WITH CATALUNYA WIN.

text.p: Defending world champion Tommi Makinen stretched his lead in this year's title race with victory in the Catalunya Rally on Wednesday.

Finland's Makinen, driving a Mitsubishi, finished seven seconds ahead of Italian Piero Liatti in his Subaru for his second consecutive win, following his success in the Rally of Portugal three weeks ago.
Makinen had started the final leg of the rally sharing the lead with Liatti. Over the first three stages of the day he built up a 10-second advantage over his rival.
But on the penultimate stage, the 17th, Liatti set the fastest time to bring the gap down to four seconds and set up a thrilling final stage, which Makinen completed three seconds faster.
Such a close finish is rare in world rallying, though last year's Catalunya Rally saw winner Briton Colin McRae finish just seven seconds ahead of Subaru team mate Liatti.

Frenchman Gilles Panizzi brought the Peugeot team some consolation with a fine third-place finish. He had led for much of the opening day in his two-wheel drive car and lost the lead only when he suffered a puncture on the sixth stage.

Panizzi's team mate, Frenchman Francois Delecour, was disqualified on Wednesday when he was bump-started by one of his team's support vehicles after mechanical problems had prevented him reaching the start line.

McRae finished in fourth place after matching the leaders for pace on the final day. His hopes for victory were ruined by a puncture on the 11th stage after he had led the rally for the start of the second leg.
